head.title: Do Gas Guzzlers Aid Our Enemies?

hedline.hl1: Do Gas Guzzlers Aid Our Enemies?

block.p: I agree with Thomas L. Friedman that the moralistic and economic benefits of a geo-green policy would leave our nation in much safer hands.
I agree with Thomas L. Friedman that the moralistic and economic benefits of a geo-green policy would leave our nation in much safer hands.

Our current situation is a failure brought on as much by the ineptitude of Democrats and environmentalists as by President Bush's backward policies. Democrats must challenge our country's perilous foreign policy, starting with our reliance on the very enemies we seek to destroy.

In response to Mr. Friedman's question, today's college kids are indeed fighting the good fight. As a senior at Cornell University, I have observed great willingness on the part of academic institutions to fight global warming and strive toward energy independence.
Cornell agreed after student protests to seek to reduce greenhouse emissions to 7 percent below 1990 levels. The school's efforts are now saving the university $7 million a year on its energy bill.
